item.title: Veljan Denison Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Veljan Denison Ltd, a micro-cap player in the Auto Components & Equipments sector, has recently formed a Death Cross—a technical pattern where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average—indicating a potential shift towards a bearish trend and signalling deterioration in the stock’s medium to long-term momentum. Time: 7 minutes ago

This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting a deterioration in the stock’s medium to long-term momentum and raising concerns about sustained weakness ahead. Time: 27 minutes ago

item.title: Hitachi Energy India Ltd Forms Death Cross Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Hitachi Energy India Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average, signalling a potential shift towards a bearish trend. This development suggests a deterioration in the stock’s short-term momentum relative to its long-term trend, raising concerns about sustained weakness despite the company’s strong historical performance. item.title: Latteys Industries Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend

This development highlights a deterioration in the stock’s momentum and raises concerns about its medium to long-term outlook amid already subdued fundamentals and weak price performance. item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Reveal Mixed Market Momentum
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a mixed bag of results across 2315 companies, reflecting a cautious yet gradually improving corporate performance landscape. While the proportion of companies reporting positive results has inched up to 47.0%, sectoral and market-capitalisation-wise disparities remain evident, underscoring the uneven recovery and growth trajectories across the Indian equity market. Time: 28 minutes ago

item.title: Super Spinning Mills Q3 FY26: Profit Surge Masks Underlying Structural Weaknesses
item.description: Super Spinning Mills Ltd., a micro-cap textile manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹45.00 crores, reported a striking 132% quarter-on-quarter surge in net profit to ₹1.16 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), yet the company's shares continued their downward trajectory, declining 2.0% to ₹7.84 following the announcement. The quarterly profit jump, whilst impressive on the surface, comes against a backdrop of stagnant revenue growth and deteriorating long-term fundamentals that have left investors increasingly sceptical about the sustainability of this performance. Time: 42 minutes ago

item.title: B.L.Kashyap Q3 FY26: Profit Surge Masks Underlying Weakness in Construction Major
item.description: B.L.Kashyap & Sons Ltd., a civil construction and EPC contracting company, reported a sharp turnaround in Q3 FY26 with net profit of ₹11.83 crores, marking a dramatic recovery from the previous quarter's loss of ₹8.62 crores. However, the stock tumbled 6.33% to ₹54.12 on February 11, 2026, as investors looked beyond the headline numbers to concerning trends in revenue momentum and margin sustainability. With a market capitalisation of ₹1,275 crores, the micro-cap construction firm faces mounting scrutiny over its ability to sustain profitability amid operational challenges and elevated debt levels. Time: 42 minutes ago

item.title: Emami Realty Q3 FY26: Mounting Losses Deepen as Revenue Collapses 91%
item.description: Emami Realty Ltd., the Kolkata-headquartered real estate developer, reported deeply troubling third-quarter results for FY2026, with net losses widening to ₹37.28 crores and revenue plummeting 91.45% year-on-year to just ₹4.89 crores. The micro-cap company, valued at ₹346.00 crores, continues to struggle with operational challenges that have now persisted across multiple quarters, raising serious questions about its business model sustainability. Time: 42 minutes ago

item.title: Kairosoft AI Solutions Q3 FY26: Operational Turnaround Overshadowed by Structural Concerns
item.description: Kairosoft AI Solutions Ltd., a micro-cap player in the auto components and equipments sector, reported a net profit of ₹0.75 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), marking a sequential improvement of 7.14% from Q2 FY26's ₹0.70 crores. However, the company's shares remain under severe pressure, trading at ₹51.15 with a market capitalisation of just ₹6.00 crores—down 78.99% over the past year and 84.49% below its 52-week high of ₹329.75. Time: 42 minutes ago

item.title: Asian Star Company Q3 FY26: Margin Pressures Mount Amid Demand Slowdown
item.description: Asian Star Company Ltd., one of India's established diamantaires engaged in diamond cutting, polishing, and jewellery manufacturing, reported a challenging third quarter for FY2026, with consolidated net profit declining 18.70% year-on-year to ₹9.78 crores. The micro-cap company, with a market capitalisation of ₹1,013 crores, saw its stock trading at ₹640.50 on February 11, 2026, reflecting a modest 1.18% gain for the day but remaining 26.38% below its 52-week high of ₹870. Time: 42 minutes ago
